tags.name: Orders

info.title: SDigital2 Manual Order Desk API
info.description:
SDigital2 Manual Order Desk API enables seamless transactions between fiat currencies and cryptocurrencies. Our API provides a robust platform for managing payments, recipients, and orders with enterprise-grade security and reliability. ## Features | Feature | Availability | | ------- | ------------ | | **Fiat & Crypto Support**
Process payments in multiple fiat currencies (USD, BRL, MXN) and cryptocurrencies (USDC, USDT) across different networks | ‚úì | | **Recipient Management**
Create and manage recipients for both fiat and crypto payments with validation and security checks | ‚úì | | **Order Processing**
Create, confirm, and track payment orders with real-time status updates and detailed transaction history | ‚úì | | **Payment Identifiers**
Track wire transfers with IMAD/OMAD identifiers for complete payment visibility | ‚úì | ## Supported Currencies ### Fiat Currencies - `USD` ‚Äî United States Dollar - `BRL` ‚Äî Brazilian Real - `MXN` ‚Äî Mexican Peso ### Cryptocurrencies - `USDC_ETH` ‚Äî USDC on Ethereum network - `USDT_ETH` ‚Äî USDT on Ethereum network - `USDT_TRX` ‚Äî USDT on Tron network ## Getting Started 1. Get your API key and learn about [authentication](/docs#description/authentication). 2. Set up [recipients](/docs#tag/recipients) for payments. 3. Create and manage [orders](/docs#tag/orders). 4. Track orders and payments with our [monitoring tools](/docs#description/monitoring). ## API Overview Our RESTful API uses standard HTTP methods and returns JSON responses. Here's a quick example: ```bash # Create a new order curl -X POST "http://localhost:3000/v1/orders" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "x-api-key: your_api_key_here" \ -d '{ "from": { "currency": "USD", "amount": 1000 }, "to": { "currency": "USDC_ETH", "recipient_id": 123 }, "is_third_party": false }' ``` ## Guides - [Complete Workflow](/docs#description/workflow) - [Recipients Guide](/docs#tag/recipients) - [Orders Guide](/docs#tag/orders) - [Monitoring Guide](/docs#description/monitoring)

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user who created the order.

sender_legal_name.description:
Legal name of the sender.

**Required** when sender differs from the account holder.

sender_bank_account_last_4.description:
Last 4 digits of sender's bank account.

**Required** for USD wire transfers.

is_third_party.description: Indicates if the recipient is a third party. Affects required fields.

purpose_of_payment.description:
Reason for payment.

**Required** for third-party transactions.

invoice_file_url.description:
URL to invoice document.

**Required** for third-party transactions.

transaction_hash.description: Blockchain transaction hash for cryptocurrency transfers.

created_at.description: [ISO 8601 timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) indicating when this entity was first created in the system.

updated_at.description: [ISO 8601 timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) indicating when this entity was last updated in the system.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Order record with all details and current status.

OrderType.title: Order Type
OrderType.description:
Specifies whether the order converts:
- `on-ramp`: fiat to crypto
- `off-ramp`: crypto to fiat

OrderStatus.title: Order Status
OrderStatus.description:
Current state of the order in its lifecycle:

- `pending`: Initial state
- `submitted`: Order validated and accepted
- `raised`: Funds detected
- `sent`: Transfer initiated
- `received`: Transfer completed
- `cancelled`: Order cancelled
- `unknown`: Status cannot be determined

CryptoToken.title: Crypto Token
CryptoToken.description: The crypto token, in the form of `{symbol}_{chain}`, e.g., `USDC_ETH`

FiatCurrency.title: Fiat Currency
FiatCurrency.description: The fiat currency code in [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format.

DepositInstructions.description: Unified schema for both cryptocurrency and fiat currency deposit instructions.

wallet_address.description: Destination wallet address for receiving crypto funds.

bank_name.description: Full legal name of the receiving financial institution.

account_holder_name.description: Legal name of the bank account owner as registered with the institution.

account_number.description: Primary account number (PAN) for receiving deposits.

address_line_1.description: Primary address line of the banking institution (street, building, suite).

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line (city, state/province, postal code, country).

routing_code.description: Domestic bank routing number or ABA (American Banking Association) code.

FiatDomesticDepositInstructions.title: Domestic Bank Details
FiatDomesticDepositInstructions.description: Banking information required for domestic wire or ACH transfers.

bank_name.description: Full legal name of the receiving financial institution.

account_holder_name.description: Legal name of the bank account owner as registered with the institution.

account_number.description: Primary account number (PAN) for receiving deposits.

address_line_1.description: Primary address line of the banking institution (street, building, suite).

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line (city, state/province, postal code, country).

swift_bic.description: SWIFT/BIC (Bank Identifier Code) for international transfers.

reference.description: Unique reference code to track international wire transfers.

FiatInternationalDepositInstructions.title: International Bank Details
FiatInternationalDepositInstructions.description: Banking information required for SWIFT/international wire transfers.

imad.description:
**IMAD** (Input Message Accountability Data)

Unique identifier for incoming wire transfers.

omad.description:
**OMAD** (Output Message Accountability Data)

Unique identifier for outgoing wire transfers.

currency.description: Currency or token for this endpoint.

amount.description: **Important**: Transaction amount must be specified in either source or destination, not both.

from.description: Source endpoint details, including currency and optional amount.

recipient_id.description: Unique identifier for the recipient. Must be previously created via Recipients API.

currency.description: Currency or token for this endpoint.

amount.description: **Important**: Transaction amount must be specified in either source or destination, not both.

to.description: Destination endpoint details, including recipient and currency.

sender_legal_name.description:
Legal name of the sender.

**Required** when sender differs from the account holder.

sender_bank_account_last_4.description:
Last 4 digits of sender's bank account.

**Required** for USD wire transfers.

is_third_party.description: Indicates if the recipient is a third party. Affects required fields.

purpose_of_payment.description:
Reason for payment.

**Required** for third-party transactions.

invoice_file_url.description:
URL to invoice document.

**Required** for third-party transactions.

developer_fee.description:
The fee, expressed as a decimal number, represents the amount you wish to reserve for your own account. This fee is the final amount deducted from what your customer ultimately receives, rather than a percentage.

It is denominated in the source currency if that is a fiat currency, or in the fiat currency to which the source currency is pegged.

OrderCreate.title: Create Order
OrderCreate.description: Parameters for creating a new order.

transaction_hash.description:
Blockchain transaction hash.

**Required** for cryptocurrency transfers.

OrderConfirm.title: Confirm Order
OrderConfirm.description: Parameters for confirming an order completion.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user who owns this recipient.

address.description:
**Wallet Address**
- Must be a valid address for the specified token
- Case-insensitive
- No spaces allowed

name.description: Legal registered business name of the recipient organization.

business_details.description: Business entity details for the recipient.

is_active.description: Indicates if the recipient is currently active and available for transactions.

CryptoRecipient.title: Crypto Recipient
CryptoRecipient.description: Represents a cryptocurrency recipient for digital asset transfers.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user who owns this recipient.

is_active.description: Indicates if the recipient is currently active and available for transactions.

FiatDomesticRecipient.title: Domestic Fiat Recipient
FiatDomesticRecipient.description: Represents a domestic (US) bank account recipient.

name.description: Legal registered business name as it appears on bank documents.

address.description: Complete street address of the business headquarters.

postal_code.description: Valid postal/ZIP code for the business address.

bank_name.description: Official name of the banking institution.

bank_address.description: Complete physical address of the bank branch.

account_number.description:
**Bank Account Number**
- Required for domestic (US) transfers
- 4-17 digits
- No spaces or special characters

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user who owns this recipient.

is_active.description: Indicates if the recipient is currently active and available for transactions.

FiatInternationalRecipient.title: International Fiat Recipient
FiatInternationalRecipient.description: Represents an international bank account recipient.

bank_name.description: Official name of the banking institution.

bank_address.description: Complete physical address of the bank branch.

account_bic_swift_code.description:
**BIC/SWIFT Code**
- Required for international transfers
- 8 or 11 characters
- Format: `XXXXXX[XX][XXX]`

bank_name.description: Name of the US-based intermediary bank.

account_routing_number.description:
**ABA Routing Number**
- 9 digits
- Must be valid US routing number
- Required for international transfers

IntermediaryBankDetails.title: Intermediary Bank Details
IntermediaryBankDetails.description: US intermediary bank information for international wire transfers.
